titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Milligans, Morrises, and Strettells were prominent Pennsylvania and New Jersey families. James Milligan was appointed Auditor General of the United States in 1779. Cadwalader Morris was a Pennsylvania delegate to the Continental Congress, 1783-1784. Robert and Amos Strettell were shippers and landowners in Philadelphia and New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence, deeds, and estate papers of the Milligan, Morris, and Strettell families. The correspondence covers a wide range of topics, including politics, trade, travel, and family matters. Correspondents include members of the Morris, Milligan, and Strettell families, as well as Samuel Powel, Benjamin Chew, and Daniel Roberdeau. Estate papers include wills, receipts, mortgages, and inventories.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Strettell Family papers (0640).
